additional_info.title: FAQ 1
additional_info.body:
Q: I control a Queen of Hearts- Sensing Weakness, a Jafar- Keeper of Secrets and have 1 card in my hand. If my Jafar- Keeper of Secrets challenges my opponent’s Stitch- New Dog and I use the Let the Games Begin ability of my Queen of Hearts, how much damage does Stitch take from the challenge?

A: 2 damage. Queen of Hearts- Sensing Weakness’ Let the Games Begin ability applies as soon as a challenge is declared, before the challenge itself has happened. This means that when the challenge occurs Jafar- Keeper of Secrets will see that you have 2 cards in hand and will gain 2 strength total from his Hidden Wonders ability.

characters.rules_text: Shift 2 (You may pay 2 to play this on top of one of your characters named Queen of Hearts.) LET THE GAME BEGIN Whenever one of your characters challenges another character, you may draw a card.

additional_info.title: FAQ 6
additional_info.body:
Q: I control a copy of Beast- Selfless Protector and a copy of The Prince- Never Gives Up. My opponent controls a copy of Flounder- Voice of Reason. In this situation if I play Teeth and Ambitions and choose The Prince as my character to deal 2 damage to, how much damage will be placed on what characters?

A: 1 damage will be placed on The Beast- Selfless Protector and 2 damage will be placed on Flounder- Voice of Reason.

additional_info.title: FAQ 1
additional_info.body:
Q: I control a copy of Cinderella - Knight in Training that has been in play for a turn. If I play a Zero to Hero and then shift a Cinderella - Stouthearted onto my Cinderella - Knight in Training can that Cinderella - Stouthearted challenge ready characters that turn?

A: No. Cinderella - Stouthearted’s ability is a trigger ability that happens when you play a song. If Cinderella - Stouthearted is not in play when you play a song card she will not be able to challenge even if she is played later in the turn.

characters.rules_text: Shift 5 (You may pay 5 to play this on top of one of your characters named Cinderella.) Resist +2 (Damage dealt to this character is reduced by 2.) THE SINGING SWORD Whenever you play a song, this character may challenge ready characters this turn.

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
If Moana – Of Motunui quests, can I choose which princesses I ready? If I had Princesses already readied or I ready them with other effects later in the turn, can they quest that turn?

A: If you choose to use Moana’s We Can Fix It ability to ready your other Princess characters, you must ready all of them. If you quest with Moana – Of Motunui, no other Princesses can quest for the rest of your turn, regardless of whether you chose to ready them with her ability or they are readied later in the turn.

characters.flavor_text: I am Moana of Motunui. You will board my boat, sail across the sea, and restore the heart of Te Fiti.
characters.rules_text: WE CAN FIX IT Whenever this character quests, you may ready your other Princess characters. They can't quest for the rest of this turn.

additional_info.title: FAQ 2
additional_info.body:
Q: Say I have Stitch – Rock Star in play and a cost 3 character in my hand. If I use Lantern so I can pay 1 {I} less to play that character, can I then exert them to draw a card?

A: It’s not the cost of the character you play that’s reduced by Lantern; it’s the amount you have to pay. The new character’s cost would still be 3, so they wouldn’t qualify to be a fan of Stitch.

characters.flavor_text: The best part about a beachside concert is that there’s always room for one more.

Q: Say I have an Elsa in play and I choose a ready character for Anna – Heir to Arendelle’s ability Loving Heart. If that chosen character is exerted later in the turn, will they stay exerted during the start of the next turn?

A: Yes, the chosen character will stay exerted by Anna’s effect.

characters.name: Dr. Facilier
characters.subtitle: Agent Provocateur
characters.author: Isaiah Mesq

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q. If I control Dr. Facilier – Agent Provocateur and one of my Floodborn characters who used their Shift ability to be played on top of another card is banished in a challenge, do all cards in the stack go back to my hand?

A. No. Because the stack of cards all go to your discard pile first and become separate cards, you could only return the top card of the stack to your hand.

characters.rules_text: Shift 5 (You may pay 5 to play this on top of one of your characters named Dr. Facilier.) INTO THE SHADOWS Whenever one of your other characters is banished in a challenge, you may return that card to your hand.

A: Dr. Facilier’s effect will not occur until after you fully resolve the text on Friends on the Other Side.

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: I have 2 cards in my hand. My Jafar – Keeper of Secrets challenges an opposing Flynn Rider – Charming Rogue. When do I use Flynn Rider’s Here Comes the Smolder ability? How much damage will Flynn Rider take from the challenge, considering Jafar’s ability Hidden Wonders?
A: You use Flynn Rider – Charming Rogue’s Here Comes the Smolder ability as soon as he’s chosen for an opposing character’s challenge. This means the challenging player must discard a card before any damage from the challenge is dealt to either character. In this case, you’ll have to discard 1 of your 2 cards, so you’ll have 1 card left. Jafar – Keeper of Secret’s ability increases his Strength by the amount equal to the number of cards in your hand, so Jafar will have 1 Strength when he deals damage to Flynn Rider.

additional_info.title: FAQ - Challenges
additional_info.body:
Q: Are abilities on characters that occur when they’re banished in a challenge considered to happen during the challenge?

A: Abilities on characters that occur when they are banished in a challenge happen during that challenge.

Example: Marshmallow – Persistent Guardian has an ability that reads, “When this character is banished in a challenge, you may return this card to your hand,” and Cheshire Cat – Not All There has an ability that reads, “When this character is challenged and banished, banish the challenging character.”
If a player challenges and banishes Cheshire Cat with Marshmallow, the Cheshire Cat’s ability would banish Marshmallow during the challenge, allowing the challenging player to return Marshmallow to their hand.

Q: If I use Freeze and choose to exert my opponent’s The Queen – Wicked and Vain, will The Queen’s exert ability I Summon Thee allow me to draw a card?

A: No. When an ability has a cost, the card’s player must pay that cost in order to use the ability. If another effect exerts The Queen, you don’t get to draw the card from I Summon Thee. Additionally, you won’t be able to use that ability until The Queen is readied.

additional_info.body:
Challenger is additive, meaning you add up all numerical instances of it for a combined
+N {S} gain.

Example: If you have two of Tinker Bell – Peter Pan’s Ally in play, each of them gives your Peter Pan characters Challenger +1, giving him a total of Challenger +2.

additional_info.body:
Q: When I use Belle – Strange but Special’s Read a Book ability, can I place any card into my inkwell or does it need to have the inkwell icon?

A: Belle’s Read A Book ability only allows you to put another card into your inkwell; it doesn’t override any other rules of the normal process of adding a card to your inkwell. The card must have the inkwell icon and you must show it to all players before putting it in your inkwell.

additional_info.title: FAQ - Timing
additional_info.body:
Q. When more than one effect happens at the same time, what order do they resolve in?

A. If multiple effects of yours happen at the same time during your turn, you choose the order in which they occur, then resolve the effects in that order. After that, each other player resolves their effects in turn, starting with the player to your left.

Example: If you have Dr. Facilier – Agent Provocateur in play and your Gramma Tala – Storyteller is challenged and banished, you choose whether to return the Gramma Tala card to your hand or put it into your inkwell.

characters.flavor_text: Moana: Is there something you want to tell me? Gramma Tala: Is there something you want to hear?

additional_info.title: FAQ - Inkwell
additional_info.body:
Q: If a card from the top of the deck is put into my inkwell by an effect like Mickey Mouse – Detective’s ability Got a Clue, can I check what that card is before it goes facedown?

A: No. Cards put into an inkwell from any location where the card’s information isn’t known, such as the top of a deck, can’t be looked at by either player.

additional_info.title: FAQ - Challenges
additional_info.body:
Q: If I banish a shifted Floodborn card in a challenge while I have a card that lets me gain 1 lore when I banish a character, how much lore do I gain?

A: No matter how many cards are in a shifted character’s stack, they still count as a single character. Only the top card of a shifted character’s stack is considered banished for the purpose of effects like this.

Example: If you banish a shifted character with Simba – Rightful Heir, you still gain only 1 lore from his ability I Know What I Have to Do.

locations.name: Tiana's Palace
locations.subtitle: Jazz Restaurant

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: If my only character with Bodyguard is at Tiana’s Palace – Jazz Restaurant, can my opponent challenge any of my characters?
A: Yes. A challenging character must challenge an opposing character with Bodyguard if able, but the Night Out ability of Tiana’s Palace makes characters there unable to be challenged. Therefore, challenging characters can challenge any character they’d normally be able to.

locations.flavor_text: In New Orleans, dreams can come true.
locations.rules_text: NIGHT OUT Characters can't be challenged while here.

locations.name: Forbidden Mountain
locations.subtitle: Maleficent's Castle
locations.author: Jimmy Lo
locations.flavor_text: An eerie quiet surrounds the castle—but beware of the dangerous occupant within.

locations.name: The Queen's Castle
locations.subtitle: Mirror Chamber
locations.author: Matthew Oates
locations.flavor_text: Those who visit the mirror can choose their question—but not the answer.
locations.rules_text: USING THE MIRROR At the start of your turn, for each character you have here, you may draw a card.

locations.name: The Sorcerer's Tower
locations.subtitle: Wondrous Workspace
locations.author: Wietse Treurniet
locations.flavor_text: Everything you need to make some magic.
locations.rules_text: BROOM CLOSET Your characters named Magic Broom may move here for free. MAGICAL POWER Characters get +1 while here.

locations.name: De Vil Manor
locations.subtitle: Cruella's Estate
locations.author: Ryan Moeck
locations.flavor_text: They say the ol’ place is haunted, or bewitched, or some such fiddle-faddle. —Colonel

locations.name: Fang
locations.subtitle: River City
locations.author: Michael Guimont
locations.flavor_text: A nation protected by fierce assassins and their even fiercer cats.
locations.rules_text: SURROUNDED BY WATER Characters gain Ward and Evasive while here. (Opponents can't choose them except to challenge. Only characters with Evasive can challenge them.)

locations.subtitle: Home of the Emperor
locations.author: Andreas Rocha
locations.flavor_text: Sure it's a little small, but also it DOESN'T HAVE A POOL! —Kuzco
locations.rules_text: CITY WALLS Whenever a character is challenged and banished while here, banish the challenging character.

locations.name: Agrabah
locations.subtitle: Marketplace
locations.author: Kaitlin Cuthbertson
locations.flavor_text: Welcome to Agrabah, city of mystery, of enchantment, and the finest merchandise this side of the river. —Merchant

locations.subtitle: Hook's Ship
locations.author: Nicolas Ky
locations.rules_text: LOOK ALIVE, YOU SWABS! Characters gain Rush while here. (They can challenge the turn they're played.) ALL HANDS ON DECK! Your Pirate characters may move here for free.

locations.name: RLS Legacy
locations.subtitle: Solar Galleon
locations.author: Wietse Treurniet
locations.rules_text: THIS IS OUR SHIP Characters gain Evasive while here. (Only characters with Evasive can challenge them.) HEAVE TOGETHER NOW If you have a character here, you pay 2 less to move a character of yours here.

locations.name: Belle's House
locations.subtitle: Maurice's Workshop
locations.author: Alex Shin

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: If I have 2 characters at Belle’s House – Maurice’s Workshop, do I pay 2 {I} less for items?
A: No. No matter how many characters you have at Belle’s House – Maurice’s Workshop, you’ll only pay 1 {I} less to play items. If you have 2 copies of Belle’s House – Maurice’s Workshop in play and a character at each of them, however, you’ll pay 2 {I} less to play items.

locations.flavor_text: Some of the most important tools in Lorcana are crafted here.
locations.rules_text: LABORATORY If you have a character here, you pay 1 less to play items.

locations.subtitle: Scrooge's Mansion
locations.author: Alex Accorsi
locations.flavor_text: It's only the coolest home in Lorcana! —Webby Vanderquack

items.flavor_text: Lanterns fill the sky on one special night, beacons of hope and love.
items.rules_text: BIRTHDAY LIGHTS — You pay 1 less for the next character you play this turn.

items.name: Ursula’s Shell Necklace
items.author: Jenna Gray
items.flavor_text: Singing is a lovely pastime... if you’ve got the voice for it. —Ursula
items.rules_text: NOW, SING! Whenever you play a song, you may pay 1 to draw a card.

items.name: The Magic Feather
items.author: Mariana Moreno
items.rules_text: NOW YOU CAN FLY! When you play this item, choose a character of yours. While this item is in play, that character gains Evasive. (Only characters with Evasive can challenge them.) GROUNDED 3 — Return this item to your hand.

items.name: Magic Mirror
items.author: Andrew Trabbold
items.flavor_text: What wouldst thou know, my Queen?
items.rules_text: SPEAK! , 4 — Draw a card.

items.flavor_text: No wonder you’re late. Why, this watch is exactly two days slow. —The Mad Hatter
items.rules_text: I'M LATE! , 1 — Chosen character gains Rush this turn. (They can challenge the turn they're played.)

items.name: Rose Lantern
items.author: Gabriel Angelo
items.flavor_text: The transformed rose made short work of the Beast’s wound. But even the gentlest magic comes at a cost.
items.rules_text: MYSTICAL PETALS , 2 — Move 1 damage counter from chosen character to chosen opposing character.

items.name: Family Fishing Pole
items.author: Carlos Ruiz
items.rules_text: WATCH CLOSELY This item enters play exerted. THE PERFECT CAST , 1 , Banish this item — Return chosen exerted character of yours to your hand to gain 2 lore.

items.author: Andrew Peña
items.flavor_text: I would <love> to help you, of course, but there’s the little matter of the contract... —Ursula

items.author: Defne Tözüm
items.rules_text: DISCIPLINE AND STRENGTH , 2 — Chosen character gets +2 this turn. Whenever they challenge another character this turn, you may draw a card.

items.author: Peter Brockhammer

items.rules_text: YOU KNOW WHAT HAPPENS , 2 — Draw cards equal to the damage on chosen character of yours, then banish them.

items.name: Aurelian Gyrosensor
items.author: Mario Oscar Gabriele
items.flavor_text: It can point you toward lost lore, but if you’re not careful, it’ll lead you off a cliff. —Venturo, an Illumineer
items.rules_text: SEEKING KNOWLEDGE Whenever one of your characters quests, you may look at the top card of your deck. Put it on either the top or the bottom of your deck.

items.name: Heart of Te Fiti
items.author: Kamil Murzyn
items.flavor_text: It takes a pure heart to calm the raging storm within.
items.rules_text: CREATE LIFE , 2 — Put the top card of your deck into your inkwell facedown and exerted.

items.author: Milica Celikovic
items.flavor_text: The coconut is a versatile gift from the gods, used to make nearly everything—including baskets to carry more coconuts.
items.rules_text: CONSIDER THE COCONUT Whenever you play a character, you may remove up to 2 damage from chosen character.

items.author: Samanta Erdini
items.flavor_text: Ashamed of his monstrous form, the Beast concealed himself inside his castle, with a magic mirror as his only window to the outside world.
items.rules_text: SHOW ME , 3 — If you have no cards in your hand, draw a card.

items.name: The Nephews' Piggy Bank
items.author: Jeremy Adams
items.rules_text: INSIDE JOB If you have a character named Donald Duck in play, you pay 1 less to play this item. PAYOFF — Chosen character gets -1 until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Scarab
items.author: Carlos Ruiz
items.flavor_text: If we can catch one, maybe we can recalibrate it to help us get rid of Jafar's illusions! —Venturo, an Illumineer
items.rules_text: SEARCH THE SANDS , 2 — Return an Illusion character card from your discard to your hand.

items.name: Ice Spikes
items.author: Priya Kakati
items.rules_text: HOLD STILL When you play this item, exert chosen opposing character. IT'S STUCK , 1 — Exert chosen opposing item. It can't ready at the start of its next turn.

items.name: Chem Purse
items.author: Jared Nickerl
items.flavor_text: Cute, but also potentially devastating. Perfect. —Honey Lemon
items.rules_text: HERE'S THE BEST PART Whenever you play a character, if you used Shift to play them, they get +4 this turn.

items.name: Jeweled Collar
items.author: Filipe Laurentino
items.flavor_text: Archazia created many wondrous things, but none as beautiful as this.
items.rules_text: WELCOME EXTRAVAGANCE Whenever one of your characters is challenged, you may put the top card of your deck into your inkwell facedown and exerted.

items.name: The Sword of Shan-Yu

items.flavor_text: I know what this means to you. —The Emperor
items.rules_text: WORTHY WEAPON , one of your characters — Ready chosen character. They can't quest for the rest of this turn.

items.name: Television Set
items.author: Mariana Moreno

items.rules_text: IS IT ON YET? , 1 — Look at the top card of your deck. If it's a Puppy character card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it on the bottom of your deck.

items.name: Belle's Favorite Book
items.author: Edgar Pasten
items.flavor_text: Some stories stay with you forever.

items.rules_text: SHIELDING LIGHT , 2 — Chosen character gains Resist +2 and Support until the start of your next turn. (Damage dealt to them is reduced by 2. Whenever they quest, you may add their to another chosen character's this turn.)

items.name: Hamster Ball
items.author: Alex Accorsi
items.rules_text: ROLL WITH THE PUNCHES , 1 — Chosen character with no damage gains Resist +2 until the start of your next turn. (Damage dealt to them is reduced by 2.)

items.name: The Sword of Shan-Yu
items.author: Jonathan Livslyst / Renée Chio
items.rules_text: WORTHY WEAPON , one of your characters — Ready chosen character. They can't quest for the rest of this turn.

items.name: Mechanical Snake
items.author: Carlos Ruiz
items.rules_text: SEIZE THE CROWN! When Jafar plays this item, he steals The Reforged Crown. DISASSEMBLED SERPENT , Banish this item — Jafar gains 2 lore.

items.name: Fiery Basin
items.author: Ilaria Sposetti / Rodney Bills
items.flavor_text: You’re playing with fire now. %—Jafar
items.rules_text: FACE THE FLAMES At the start of Jafar's turn, he banishes this item to have each Illumineer choose one of their characters and deal 4 damage to them.

items.name: Giant Hourglass
items.author: Veronica Di Lorenzo / Livio Cacciatore
items.flavor_text: It’s important to make time for friends.%—Jafar
items.rules_text: RISING SAND — Jafar deals 1 damage to each opposing character.

items.name: Amber Coil
items.author: Francesco Colucci
items.flavor_text: Martin smiled as the coil snapped into place and he felt a surge of healing energy.
items.rules_text: HEALING AURA During your turn, whenever a card is put into your inkwell, you may remove up to 2 damage from chosen character.

items.name: Spaghetti Dinner
items.author: Roberto Gatto
items.flavor_text: Hey, Tony’s! Of course. The very place for a very special occasion. —Tramp
items.rules_text: FINE DINING , 1 — If you have 2 or more characters in play, gain 1 lore.

items.name: Kanine Krunchies
items.author: Juan Diego Leon
items.flavor_text: Happy dogs are those who eat nutritious Kanine Krunchies!
items.rules_text: YOU CAN BE A CHAMPION, TOO Your Puppy characters get +1.

items.name: The Glass Slipper
items.author: Tania Soler
items.rules_text: PERFECT PAIR You may only have 2 copies of The Glass Slipper in your deck. SEARCH THE KINGDOM Banish this item, one of your Prince characters — Search your deck for a Princess character card and reveal it to all players. Put that card into your hand and shuffle your deck.

items.name: Amethyst Coil
items.author: Francesco Colucci

items.rules_text: MAGICAL TOUCH During your turn, whenever a card is put into your inkwell, you may move 1 damage counter from chosen character to chosen opposing character.

items.name: Emerald Coil
items.author: Francesco Colucci
items.flavor_text: The coil Martin wore lifted his spirits as well as his body.

items.name: Ruby Coil
items.author: Francesco Colucci
items.flavor_text: Venturo felt a spark from his arm coil, and energy flooded his strained muscles.
items.rules_text: CRIMSON SPARK During your turn, whenever a card is put into your inkwell, chosen character gets +2 this turn.

items.name: Unconventional Tool
items.author: Levi Rogers
items.flavor_text: I use this one a lot more than you'd think! —Maurice
items.rules_text: FIXED IN NO TIME When this item is banished, you pay 2 less for the next item you play this turn.

items.name: Maurice's Machine
items.author: Isaiah Mesq
items.flavor_text: I hope it does what I built it to do! —Maurice
items.rules_text: BREAK DOWN When this item is banished, you may return an item card with cost 2 or less from your discard to your hand.

items.name: Devil's Eye Diamond
items.author: Juan Diego Leon
items.flavor_text: Just look at it, filled with power for its owner. —Madame Medusa
items.rules_text: THE PRICE OF POWER — If one of your characters was damaged this turn, gain 1 lore.

items.name: Sapphire Coil
items.author: Francesco Colucci

items.rules_text: BRILLIANT SHINE During your turn, whenever a card is put into your inkwell, you may give chosen character -2 this turn.

items.name: Baymax's Charging Station

items.flavor_text: Battery at 100%. Ready for action! —Hiro
items.rules_text: ENERGY CONVERTER Whenever you play a Floodborn character, if you used Shift to play them, you may draw a card.

items.name: Steel Coil
items.author: Francesco Colucci
items.flavor_text: As the coil clicked onto Shanzay's arm, she felt a strengthened sense of clarity.
items.rules_text: METALLIC FLOW During your turn, whenever a card is put into your inkwell, you may draw a card, then choose and discard a card.

items.name: Training Staff
items.author: Roberto Gatto
items.flavor_text: Do not sit idle while others quest for glory. —Li Shang
items.rules_text: PRECISION STRIKE , 1 — Chosen character gains Challenger +2 this turn. (They get +2 while challenging.)

items.name: The Glass Slipper

items.rules_text: PERFECT PAIR You may only have 2 copies of The Glass Slipper in your deck. SEARCH THE KINGDOM Banish this item, one of your Prince characters — Search your deck for a Princess character card and reveal it to all players. Put that card into your hand and shuffle your deck.

items.name: Devil's Eye Diamond

items.rules_text: THE PRICE OF POWER — If one of your characters was damaged this turn, gain 1 lore.

items.name: Naveen's Ukulele
items.author: Levi Rogers
items.flavor_text: I love this instrument! I strum, everyone dances. —Prince Naveen
items.rules_text: MAKE IT SING 1 , Banish this item — Chosen character counts as having +3 cost to sing songs this turn.

items.name: Pooh Pirate Ship
items.author: Kaitlin Cuthbertson
items.flavor_text: The friendliest ship on the Azurite Sea.
items.rules_text: MAKE A RESCUE , 3 — Return a Pirate character card from your discard to your hand.

items.name: Scrump
items.author: Kapik

items.rules_text: I MADE HER one of your characters — Chosen character gets -2 until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Maleficent's Staff

items.flavor_text: Alice: My goodness, the tea missed the cup! Mad Hatter: No, no, my dear—the cup missed the tea!
items.rules_text: NO ROOM, NO ROOM , 1 — Each opponent puts the top card of their deck into their discard.

items.name: The Lamp
items.author: Ever Galvez / Anna Stosik

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: I have 2 copies of Jafar – Lamp Thief and 1 Genie – Supportive Friend in play. If I use the Good or Evil ability of The Lamp, what are my choices?
A: If you have a character named Jafar in play when you use the Good or Evil ability of The Lamp, you must draw 2 cards. You can’t draw more cards even if you have other Jafar characters in play. If you have a character named Genie in play, you must return a chosen character with cost 4 or less to their player's hand. Neither is optional, and if you have both a character named Jafar and a character named Genie in play, you must do both.

items.rules_text: GOOD OR EVIL Banish this item — If you have a character named Jafar in play, draw 2 cards. If you have a character named Genie in play, return chosen character with cost 4 or less to their player's hand.

additional_info.title: FAQ 1
additional_info.body:
Q: Can I return a copy of Alice- Growing Girl from my discard to my hand with the effect of Dragon gem?

A: No, you cannot. Dragon Gem’s ability can only be used on characters who have Support as an ability. Even though Alice’s ability mentions support she herself does not have Support and therefore cannot be returned to your hand by the ability of Dragon Gem.

additional_info.title: FAQ

Q: Say I have Stitch – Rock Star in play and a cost 3 character in my hand. If I use Lantern so I can pay 1 {I} less to play that character, can I then exert them to draw a card?

A: It’s not the cost of the character you play that’s reduced by Lantern; it’s the amount you have to pay. The new character’s cost would still be 3, so they wouldn’t qualify to be a fan of Stitch.

A: No. The ink cost to use Ursula’s Shell Necklace must be paid independently from the cost of playing the song.

items.name: Shield of Virtue
items.author: Eri Welli
items.flavor_text: Arm thyself with this enchanted Shield of Virtue and this mighty Sword of Truth, for these weapons of righteousness will triumph over evil. —Flora

items.name: Sword of Truth
items.author: Andrew Trabbold

items.flavor_text: The coconut is a versatile gift from the gods, used to make nearly everything—including baskets to carry more coconuts.
items.rules_text: CONSIDER THE COCONUT Whenever you play a character, you may remove up to 2 damage from chosen character.

items.name: Eye of the Fates
items.author: Ron Baird
items.flavor_text: You can change the future once you know what you're looking at.

items.name: Fishbone Quill
items.author: Tanisha Cherislin

additional_info.title: FAQ - Inkwell
additional_info.body:
Q: If I use the ability of Fishbone Quill to put a card from my hand into my inkwell, should I show my opponent the card I choose?

A: No. If an ability lets you put any card into an inkwell (regardless of whether it has an inkwell icon), you don’t show the card to opponents.

items.flavor_text: If you want to cross the bridge, my sweet, you've got to pay the toll. —Ursula
items.rules_text: GO AHEAD AND SIGN — Put any card from your hand into your inkwell facedown.

items.name: Magic Golden Flower
items.author: Cory Godbey
items.flavor_text: Once upon a time, a single drop of sunlight fell from the heavens.. . . —Flynn Rider
items.rules_text: HEALING POLLEN Banish this item — Remove up to 3 damage from chosen character.

items.name: Scepter of Arendelle
items.author: Grace Tran
items.rules_text: COMMAND — Chosen character gains Support this turn. (Whenever they quest, you may add their to another chosen character's this turn.)

items.name: Beast’s Mirror
items.author: Samanta Erdini
items.flavor_text: Ashamed of his monstrous form, the Beast concealed himself inside his castle, with a magic mirror as his only window to the outside world.
items.rules_text: SHOW ME , 3 — If you have no cards in your hand, draw a card.

items.author: Kamil Murzyn
items.flavor_text: It’s a fine piece of cookware, but as a weapon it’s truly stunning.

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: If my opponent has cards in their discard, do I have to shuffle at least 1 of them into their deck when I play It Calls Me?
A: No. You can choose any number up to 3 to shuffle into their deck, including 0.

actions.flavor_text: I am everything I’ve learned and more
actions.rules_text: (A character with cost 1 or more can to play this song for free.) Draw a card. Then, choose up to 3 cards from chosen opponent's discard and shuffle them into their deck.

actions.name: Last-Ditch Effort
actions.author: Ian MacDonald

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: My opponent has only a Cogsworth – Grandfather Clock in play, who has Ward. Can I still play Last-Ditch Effort and give my character Challenger +2 even though I can’t choose an opposing character?
A: Yes. When there are no eligible opposing characters to choose for the first part of Last-Ditch Effort, that part of its effect simply finishes without exerting a character. However, the second part of its effect still happens, so you still choose a character of yours to get Challenger +2 until the end of the turn.

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: I used the Support ability of one of my questing characters to increase the Strength of my Felicia – Always Hungry to 6 {S}. Can I play Divebomb and banish that Felicia to banish an opposing character with 5 {S} or less?
A: Yes. The character you choose to banish with Divebomb’s effect must have less Strength than the character you banished with Divebomb had at the point they were banished. In this example, you could choose any opposing character with 5 {S} or less.

actions.name: On Your Feet! Now!
actions.author: Lisanne Koeteeuw

additional_info.title: FAQ
additional_info.body:
Q: If I have a character with Resist+1 in play when I play On Your Feet! Now! will that character be able to quest after I ready them?
A: No. On Your Feet! Now! affects all of your characters that are in play for each of its effects. First it will ready them and deal 1 damage to each of them. Those with Resist +1 will reduce that damage by 1 before any damage is dealt to them and receive no damage. All your characters will be unable to quest the rest of the turn, even if they were ready when On Your Feet! Now! was played and even if they didn’t receive damage from it.

actions.name: Zero to Hero
actions.author: Rob Di Salvo

additional_info.title: FAQ 1
additional_info.body:
Q: I currently have 10 characters and play a copy of Zero to Hero. In this case can I play a character from my hand that costs 5 ink for free using the ability of Zero to Hero?

A: Due to the effect of Zero to Hero you pay 10 less ink to play the next character you play. If that character costs equal to or less than 10 then you play it for free (you do not exert any ink to play it). Note that even in the above instance you may only reduce the cost of a single character. Even if you have 10 characters in play when you play Zero to hero you may not play 2 5 cost characters for free, just 1 character that costs 10 or less free or a character that costs more than 10 for 10 less than their printed cost.

A: No. When an ability has a cost, the card’s player must pay that cost in order to use the ability. If another effect exerts The Queen, you don’t get to draw the card from I Summon Thee. Additionally, you won’t be able to use that ability until The Queen is readied.

additional_info.body:
Q: What happens if a card tells me to perform an action and I can’t do everything it tells me to do?

A: If a card says to perform an action, do as much as you can to fulfill the requirements. This does NOT apply to actions that are part of a cost.

Example: Develop Your Brain says “Look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Put one into your hand and the other on the bottom of the deck.” If you only have one card left in your deck, you look at that card and then put it in your hand.
